SPOM.content: despite so many precautions, Heidegger runs risk of reducing justice to juridical-moral rules when he prioritizes gathering to the same over disjunction w/ its cinders
SPOM.linkedContent: despite so many precautions, Heidegger runs risk of reducing justice to juridical-moral rules when he prioritizes gathering to the same over disjunction w/ its cinders

TINON.content: “cinder” [ashes] renders better what Derrida meant by trace, remaining w/out remaining, cinder is not!, testifies w/out testifying, destruction of memory itself, absolute radical forgetting: absolute non-memory communicates w/ gift—not seeking to be recognized or saved; incineration as elementary form of experience
TINON.linkedContent: “cinder” [ashes] renders better what Derrida meant by trace, remaining w/out remaining, cinder is not!, testifies w/out testifying, destruction of memory itself, absolute radical forgetting: absolute non-memory communicates w/ gift—not seeking to be recognized or saved; incineration as elementary form of experience

CIN.content: [on the structure of the text CIN, a polylogue reading, tension btwn writing and speech] “vibration of grammar in the voice” destined for the eye, or the interior voice, absolutely low voice
CIN.linkedContent: [on the structure of the text CIN, a polylogue reading, tension btwn writing and speech] “vibration of grammar in the voice” destined for the eye, or the interior voice, absolutely low voice

CIN.content: “il y la (là) cendres” [cf. POO p. 24 il y a là du secret], “there are cinders there, cinders there are” > losing equilibrium btwn eye & ear
CIN.linkedContent: “il y la (là) cendres” [cf. POO p. 24 il y a là du secret], “there are cinders there, cinders there are” > losing equilibrium btwn eye & ear

CIN.content: every cinder destined to decompose from w/in, a metaphor or metonymy of itself
CIN.linkedContent: every cinder destined to decompose from w/in, a metaphor or metonymy of itself

CIN.content: the cinder is no longer here, was (fut) it ever? [note relation btwn fire (feu) and cinders]
CIN.linkedContent: the cinder is no longer here, was (fut) it ever? [note relation btwn fire (feu) and cinders]

CIN.content: Derrida gives Cinder a proper name, is she the signatory of this text?
CIN.linkedContent: Derrida gives Cinder a proper name, is she the signatory of this text?

CIN.content: cinders: ce qui garde pour ne plus même garder, dooming (vouant) remnant (le reste) to dissolution
CIN.linkedContent: cinders: ce qui garde pour ne plus même garder, dooming (vouant) remnant (le reste) to dissolution

CIN.content: verb “incinerate” has none of the tenderness, patience of cinder, Derrida doesn’t like it
CIN.linkedContent: verb “incinerate” has none of the tenderness, patience of cinder, Derrida doesn’t like it

CIN.content: cinder: doesn’t say what it is, but what it was (fut), remains in memory of departed (feu), all our lost etymologies, fatum, fuit, functus, defunctus
CIN.linkedContent: cinder: doesn’t say what it is, but what it was (fut), remains in memory of departed (feu), all our lost etymologies, fatum, fuit, functus, defunctus

CIN.content: no cinder w/out fire, that is what is owed (se doit) to fire, [yet, if possible] w/out shadow of sacrifice, at noon, w/out debt, w/out Phoenix, au lieu d’aucun placement, place solely of incineration
CIN.linkedContent: no cinder w/out fire, that is what is owed (se doit) to fire, [yet, if possible] w/out shadow of sacrifice, at noon, w/out debt, w/out Phoenix, au lieu d’aucun placement, place solely of incineration

CIN.content: “l’incinéré n’est plus rien fors la cendre [innermost cinder furnace], un reste qui se doit de ne plus rester, ce lieu de rien qui soit, un lieu pur se chiffrât-il [marked out]” > there are cinders, what takes place in letting a place occur
CIN.linkedContent: “l’incinéré n’est plus rien fors la cendre [innermost cinder furnace], un reste qui se doit de ne plus rester, ce lieu de rien qui soit, un lieu pur se chiffrât-il [marked out]” > there are cinders, what takes place in letting a place occur

CIN.content: dissemination expresses in “il y a là cendre” what is destined by the fire to dispersion w/out return, pyrificiation of what doesn’t remain, and returns to no one
CIN.linkedContent: dissemination expresses in “il y a là cendre” what is destined by the fire to dispersion w/out return, pyrificiation of what doesn’t remain, and returns to no one

CIN.content: cinder remains, cinder there is, nonbeing, nonpresence
CIN.linkedContent: cinder remains, cinder there is, nonbeing, nonpresence

CIN.content: there are cinders only if there is a hearth, some fire or place, cinder as the house of being
CIN.linkedContent: there are cinders only if there is a hearth, some fire or place, cinder as the house of being

CIN.content: why the phrase “il y a là cendre” doesn’t belong to him [Derrida] > cinder lent, given, to so many others, cinder remains virginal (the only thing he loves), in tact (intacte), the sentence doesn’t even say the cinder
CIN.linkedContent: why the phrase “il y a là cendre” doesn’t belong to him [Derrida] > cinder lent, given, to so many others, cinder remains virginal (the only thing he loves), in tact (intacte), the sentence doesn’t even say the cinder

CIN.content: best paradigm for trace not the trail of the hunt, le frayage, wake in sea, nor love of step (pas) for its imprint, but the cinder (what remains w/out remaining from holocaust, from the all-burning [du brûle-tout]) > no longer makes a trace, or traces only by losing trace qu’elle reste à peine ——cinder gets lost down to cinder of its cinder, he burns one more time, he burns what he still adores although he already burned it, he’s intent on it (il s’y acharne)
CIN.linkedContent: best paradigm for trace not the trail of the hunt, le frayage, wake in sea, nor love of step (pas) for its imprint, but the cinder (what remains w/out remaining from holocaust, from the all-burning [du brûle-tout]) > no longer makes a trace, or traces only by losing trace qu’elle reste à peine ——cinder gets lost down to cinder of its cinder, he burns one more time, he burns what he still adores although he already burned it, he’s intent on it (il s’y acharne)

CIN.content: btwn black & white, color of writing resembles only “literality” of cinder that still inheres in a language
CIN.linkedContent: btwn black & white, color of writing resembles only “literality” of cinder that still inheres in a language

CIN.content: name “cinder” a cinder of the cinder itself
CIN.linkedContent: name “cinder” a cinder of the cinder itself

CIN.content: perhaps he [Derrida] (or she [la cinder]) knew what he set on fire, what he praised in the secret of the sentence “il y a là cendre,” but he may discover more in its unconscious, and he will die > then the phrase w/ its chance of surviving him will be more cinder than ever, and less—w/out anyone to say “I”
CIN.linkedContent: perhaps he [Derrida] (or she [la cinder]) knew what he set on fire, what he praised in the secret of the sentence “il y a là cendre,” but he may discover more in its unconscious, and he will die > then the phrase w/ its chance of surviving him will be more cinder than ever, and less—w/out anyone to say “I”

CIN.content: entrust words to a page: better to inflame you, eat yourself up immediately, not a tomb that offers patience of mourning, but a tomb of a tomb, deprived of patience of mourning
CIN.linkedContent: entrust words to a page: better to inflame you, eat yourself up immediately, not a tomb that offers patience of mourning, but a tomb of a tomb, deprived of patience of mourning

CIN.content: incineration celebrates perhaps the nothing of the all, destruction w/out return, mad w/ its desire, desperate disseminal affirmation but also its opposite: “no” to the work mourning, “no” of fire > how to accept working for his Highness (monseigneur) mourning?
CIN.linkedContent: incineration celebrates perhaps the nothing of the all, destruction w/out return, mad w/ its desire, desperate disseminal affirmation but also its opposite: “no” to the work mourning, “no” of fire > how to accept working for his Highness (monseigneur) mourning?

CIN.content: the chance of returning, when one “incenses” a sentence to infinity, adorned w/ all its dead, is more certain than securing sentence in an archive [fire guards better than archive]
CIN.linkedContent: the chance of returning, when one “incenses” a sentence to infinity, adorned w/ all its dead, is more certain than securing sentence in an archive [fire guards better than archive]

CIN.content: if you no longer recall it, it’s because the incineration/consummation of cinder proceeds from cinder itself > trace destined like everything to disappear so as to lose its way or rekindle a memory
CIN.linkedContent: if you no longer recall it, it’s because the incineration/consummation of cinder proceeds from cinder itself > trace destined like everything to disappear so as to lose its way or rekindle a memory

CIN.content: you only have mass or volume when covered w/ cinders, like covering one’s head w/ ashes in sign of mourning
CIN.linkedContent: you only have mass or volume when covered w/ cinders, like covering one’s head w/ ashes in sign of mourning

CIN.content: rebellion against Phoenix, affirmation of fire w/out place or mourning
CIN.linkedContent: rebellion against Phoenix, affirmation of fire w/out place or mourning

CIN.content: plurality of cinders, innumerable lurks (couvait) beneath the cinder
CIN.linkedContent: plurality of cinders, innumerable lurks (couvait) beneath the cinder

CIN.content: essence of cinder (its cinder itself): the insistent pharmakon of a plural body (doesn’t belong to itself) in which the retreat of fire disguises itself > if there is cinder, fire remains in retreat
CIN.linkedContent: essence of cinder (its cinder itself): the insistent pharmakon of a plural body (doesn’t belong to itself) in which the retreat of fire disguises itself > if there is cinder, fire remains in retreat

CIN.content: no Phoenix, no monument, aucune érection qui tienne—ou tombe, the cinder w/out ascension, the cinders love me [cf. “proximity loves me” from PC], “they change sex, they re-cinder themselves, they androgynocide themselves”
CIN.linkedContent: no Phoenix, no monument, aucune érection qui tienne—ou tombe, the cinder w/out ascension, the cinders love me [cf. “proximity loves me” from PC], “they change sex, they re-cinder themselves, they androgynocide themselves”

CIN.content: cinder comes in place of the gift
CIN.linkedContent: cinder comes in place of the gift

CIN.content: cinder obviously a figure, but because word “cinder,” via the name, is supposed to name the thing (not the word), it names one thing in place of another, metonymy when cinder is separated, names one thing while figuring another from which il ne rest rien de figurable en elle
CIN.linkedContent: cinder obviously a figure, but because word “cinder,” via the name, is supposed to name the thing (not the word), it names one thing in place of another, metonymy when cinder is separated, names one thing while figuring another from which il ne rest rien de figurable en elle

CIN.content: the cinder like burning semen (semence brûlante), lava destined nowhere, when you take word into your mouth, to breathe
CIN.linkedContent: the cinder like burning semen (semence brûlante), lava destined nowhere, when you take word into your mouth, to breathe

CIN.content: cinder & smoke (fumée): smoke gets lost w/out perceptible remainder, spirited away, sublimates; cinder falls (tombe), lets go, heavy, more material because it fritters away its word: it is very divisible
CIN.linkedContent: cinder & smoke (fumée): smoke gets lost w/out perceptible remainder, spirited away, sublimates; cinder falls (tombe), lets go, heavy, more material because it fritters away its word: it is very divisible

CIN.content: cendre, cenere, ashes, cinis, Asche, cendrier (a whole sentence), Aschenbecher, ashtray, cineres, ceniza ——cinder, nothing that can be in the world, remains beyond everything that is (konis epekeina tēs ousias), giving itself (es gibt ashes)—it’s nothing
CIN.linkedContent: cendre, cenere, ashes, cinis, Asche, cendrier (a whole sentence), Aschenbecher, ashtray, cineres, ceniza ——cinder, nothing that can be in the world, remains beyond everything that is (konis epekeina tēs ousias), giving itself (es gibt ashes)—it’s nothing

BSi.content: “smoke”: extraordinary word in French and English
BSi.linkedContent: “smoke”: extraordinary word in French and English

CIR.content: impossible to follow my trace, like that of Aids, I only write destinerrancy of desire, you try to calculate itinerary of texts which don’t explode immediately, nothing but fuse
CIR.linkedContent: impossible to follow my trace, like that of Aids, I only write destinerrancy of desire, you try to calculate itinerary of texts which don’t explode immediately, nothing but fuse
